frontmatter.title: SmartHOTEL
frontmatter.excerpt: I worked on a data visualization dashboard to provide the company with insights in their key metrics, to see how their BHAG (Big, Hairy, Audacious Goal) was progressing. This project was built using MeteorJS, React (with styled-components), D3.js, GraphQL and the database of choice was MongoDB. It was deployed locally on an Ubuntu Server VM and had a C# application to collect the data running on a Windows Server VM. There is nothing to show for it, since it was an internal project. No access from outside.

frontmatter.title: SmartHOTEL
frontmatter.excerpt: Continued work on my internship project.

frontmatter.title: CSS
frontmatter.excerpt: Would always pick a preprocessor or CSS-in-JS lib over vanilla if possible. Big fan of CSS Variables and the Grid spec.

frontmatter.title: HTML
frontmatter.excerpt: I'm just glad I wasn't around during the whole table-layout-everything-fad.

frontmatter.title: JavaScript
frontmatter.excerpt: I really like classes with the new (ES10) spec for private properties. I would ALWAYS pick TypeScript over JavaScript if the option is available.

frontmatter.title: React
frontmatter.excerpt: This website was built using React. I like JSX.

frontmatter.title: TypeScript
frontmatter.excerpt: I absolutely love it. It can be a hassle and it has it's limits, but I would recommend it to anyone.

frontmatter.title: Adobe After Effects
frontmatter.excerpt: I have only really used it to make short animations, or small compilations of videos for courses. Highly enjoy working with it, for sure.

frontmatter.title: Adobe Illustrator
frontmatter.excerpt: You need me to help out with design? No problem at all!

frontmatter.title: Adobe InDesign
frontmatter.excerpt: It was a requirement in college to use InDesign over Word.

frontmatter.title: D3
frontmatter.excerpt: During my internship I got to know the basics of D3.js and I have only used the SVG variant thus far, but it's been a blast.

frontmatter.title: GraphQL
frontmatter.excerpt: I think the developer experience of using GraphQL is absolutely amazing. No over- or under-fetching. Everything in 1 request. Let the server do the heavy lifting, not the client.

frontmatter.title: Jest
frontmatter.excerpt: I mean, it's one of many testing frameworks. I mainly just like the logo.

frontmatter.title: MongoDB
frontmatter.excerpt: MongoDB being provided by default in MeteorJS' stack has made it the first DB engine I have worked with. Reading the JSON-like format is easy and works well with GraphQL.

frontmatter.title: Angular
frontmatter.excerpt: I love the complexity, and I owe my love for TypeScript to it.

frontmatter.title: Cinema4D
frontmatter.excerpt: Primarily used it to make a video project, but also some low-poly creations.

frontmatter.title: PHP
frontmatter.excerpt: I have only really used PHP to build Wordpress themes, using the power of the Customizer API. Last time I touched any PHP code was in 2016.

frontmatter.title: Git
frontmatter.excerpt: I know about and understand the purpose of version control and it is one of the main things I want to get better at.

frontmatter.title: Vue
frontmatter.excerpt: Barely used it, but I'm really interested to learn more about it.
